text:
that critically inﬂuence the performance of the model. The choices we
make (e.g., the functional form of the likelihood) inﬂuence the number
and type of free parameters in the model and thereby also the ﬂexibility
and expressivity of the model. More complex models are more ﬂexible in A polynomial
y= a0 +a1x+a2x2
can also describe
linear functions by
setting a2 = 0, i.e.,
it is strictly more
expressive than a
ﬁrst-order
polynomial.
